title: 112_hr6375
content:
The "VA Major Construction Authorization and Expiring Authorities Extension Act of 2012" includes authorization for fiscal year 2013 major medical facility projects and a project in Miami, Florida. It also extends certain expiring authorities. The "VA Major Construction Authorization and Expiring Authorities Extension Act of 2012" extends various authorities related to real property, regional offices, treatment for mentally ill veterans, services for homeless veterans, housing assistance, and medical disability examinations. The Act references Title 38, United States Code for amendments or repeals. The budgetary effects will be determined by the latest statement for compliance with the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010. TITLE I--CONSTRUCTION AUTHORIZATIONS In fiscal year 2013, the Secretary of Veterans Affairs is authorized to carry out major medical facility projects including a mental health building in Seattle, WA ($222,000,000) and a spinal cord injury center in Dallas, TX ($155,200,000). Additionally, a major medical facility project in Miami, FL is authorized for a total of $41,000,000. The major medical facility project in Miami, Florida involves renovating the surgical suite and operating rooms at the Department of Veterans Affairs Medical Center. $377,200,000 is authorized for construction in fiscal year 2013, with limitations on funding sources. Funds for Construction, Major Projects, are authorized for various fiscal years and specific categories of activity. TITLE II--EXTENSIONS OF CERTAIN EXPIRING AUTHORITIES TITLE II--EXTENSIONS OF CERTAIN EXPIRING AUTHORITIES

SEC. 201. Extension of authority to calculate the net value of real property securing a defaulted loan for purposes of liquidation to October 1, 2013.

SEC. 202. Extension of authority for operation of the Department of Veterans Affairs Regional Office in Manila, the Republic of the Philippines, to December 31, 2013.

SEC. 203. Extension of authority to provide treatment, rehabilitation, and certain other services for seriously mentally ill and homeless veterans to December 31, 2013. The authority to provide expanded services to homeless veterans, housing assistance, advisory committee extension, and medical disability examinations by contract physicians have all been extended to December 31, 2013.
